Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Five held for gambling, cash seized.description: PANAJI: In gambling raids conducted at two different locations in the state on Wednesday, crime branch of Goa police arrested five persons and recovered more than Rs 43,000, superintendent of police Pankaj Singh said. Based on credible information, the crime branch constituted a team to gather more details on these gambling places, and later proceeded to conduct the raids, he said. In the first raid at old bus stand, Ponda, the accused Rajesh, 44, Sagar, 41, and Sandeep, 38, were apprehended while accepting gambling bids. Articles and cash of Rs 15,200 were recovered from the accused. The second raid was conducted near the fish market at Nagoa, Salcete where the accused Manoranjan, 38, and Francis, 59, were nabbed while accepting bids. Cash amounting to Rs 28,120 along with other articles were recovered. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Parra ryots to write to PM, CM over powe.description: SALIGAO: After the high court dismissed their petition against power lines being installed in their fields, farmers of Parra have decided to write to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and chief minister Pramod Sawant, seeking their intervention in the matter. A group of around 40 farmers had opposed the installation of 33kVA high tension lines connecting the Nagoa substation to the one at Mapusa in their fields, claiming that the project would render their farmlands unsafe for cultivation. Following orders of the district collector, the electricity department had begun work under heavy police protection. The aggrieved farmers had subsequently moved the high court, which refused to stay the work and allowed the electricity department to continue erecting poles in the fields. “The farmers of Parra are disappointed that they have not got justice,” Genevieve Fernandes, a local, said. “We have already ploughed our fields, which will now be damaged as the electricity department vehicles drive onto them to pull the power lines.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MPT expects 1.5L cruise tourists in comi.description: Panaji: Around 70,000 to 80,000 cruise passengers arrived at Mormugao Port Trust in the 2018-19 tourist season, but next season could see 1.5 lakh cruise passengers disembarking at the port to take in Goa’s sights, said MPT chairman E Ramesh Kumar. Speaking at a workshop on cruise tourism, Kumar added that the number of cruise vessel arrivals would double in the coming year.Tempering the optimism, western region director for India Tourism Neela Lad said that MPT, port authorities, customs & central excise, bureau of immigration and security agencies have to work in tandem if cruise tourism had to really take off in Goa.The workshop was organised to improve the inter-agency coordination and simplification of procedures in order to provide a “hassle-free experience” to cruise passengers, said MPT officials. “Cruise tourism helps the state strengthen its economy and is an employable opportunity for manpower. It needs five main services to work in tandem with each other—MPT, port authorities, customs, immigration and security. If these five services work together cruise tourism can be at its best,” Lad said. MPT traffic manager Vipin Menoth said the port will spare no efforts to provide all the requirements as well as upgrade port facilities, which includes a new cruise terminal, to meet the needs of cruise tourism. Amid Fomento-MMC trash talk, town suffer.description: MARGAO: In the slugfest between MMC and Fomento over the municipal solid waste plant at Sonsoddo, Margao is made to suffer in silence. MMC and Fomento may each argue that the other is to blame for the crisis, but as per the concession agreement signed between the two, a copy of which is with TOI, both are equally at fault. If Fomento failed to put into operation the landfill at the site for safe disposal of inert, MMC never bothered to cart away the reject of the unprocessed waste as mandated in the agreement. Resultantly, the inert and the reject, both comprising nearly 60% of the incoming daily waste, landed atop the decades-old mountain of garbage. A source closely associated with the setting up of the plant told TOI that the concession agreement never mandated that MMC segregate the waste and instead entailed the task to be carried out by Fomento. Fomento argues that the non-segregation of waste was the failure behind the plant not working at an optimum level. And therein lies the rub. “As MMC failed to provide us with segregated waste, the reject (of unprocessed waste) were on the higher side. Despite many reminders from time to time, MMC failed to cart away the reject, and therefore, left with no option, this 35-40% of the waste, along with the inert (15-20% of the waste), would be piled atop the existing garbage dump,” a company official said. Resultantly, the decades-old mountain of garbage, which was what was originally intended to be eliminated as per the agreement, kept on rising raising questions about the efficacy of the plant. “The MSW Rules 2016 that mandate segregation at source came into force only in 2016, while the concession agreement was signed in 2011. It’s clear Fomento intends to fall back on the changes in rules to defend its failure,” a source closely associated with the setting up of the plant told TOI. Moreover, MMC also failed to put in any monitoring mechanism to oversee the operations of the plant, as outlined in the concession agreement. “The MMC never bothered to reply to the correspondence made to it by Fomento, and mutely acted as per the dictates of Fomento. It’s now paying the price for being a silent spectator, or rather turning its eye away from the irregularities at Sonsoddo,” former chairperson of MMC Savio Coutinho, during whose tenure the concession agreement was inked, said. The foundation stone for the plant was laid on October 2, 2011. As per the original concession agreement, Fomento and IL&FS were to set up a 50-75 tonne per day capacity plant on design, build, own, operate and transfer (DBOOT) basis for a period of 25 years, at a cost of Rs 7.3 crore. However, sources said the plant never became fully functional as Fomento failed to make the landfill at the site operational. Inert, non-biodegradable residual matter of processed waste comprising 15-20% of the waste processed, had to be dumped here. The underbelly of the operations at Sonsoddo was exposed only after the recent fire at the dump. With locals protesting against more dumping of waste here, Fomento began piling the reject inside the plant until there was not enough space to handle incoming garbage. That was when Fomento blocked entry to MMC’s garbage trucks since Monday, triggering the crisis. Spread over 15,000sqm and containing 1.5 lakh tonne of mixed waste — and still rising with every passing day — the dump has turned out to be a major challenge for the MMC and the government, as acknowledged by deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai. The original proposal was to set up the plant after clearing one half of the garbage dump, while the remainder was to be capped with impermeable layers after screening the waste. “Gas wells would be constructed to take out methane and other gases formed inside. Peripheral roads will be built for material movement and inspection. The capped dump would have post-closure protocol to take care of the facility for 15 years and to monitor the leachate and gas production and to see that there is no harm to the environment,” the plant’s project proposal stated. However, this technical requirement was rendered redundant after MMC provided additional 57,700sqm land adjoining the existing garbage dump, for setting up the plant. Subsequently, Fomento came out with a proposal for scientific capping of the garbage dump, an idea that was, however, shot down by the Goa State Pollution Control Board citing environmental concerns. The change in location of the plant and the proposal for scientific capping of the garbage dump meant doing away with the necessity of segregating and treating the garbage dump. Though scientific capping of the garbage dump failed to materialise, the original idea of eliminating the old dump was conveniently relegated to the back-burner. A source well versed with the legal matters of MMC, requesting anonymity, expressed apprehensions that the recent developments at Sonsoddo could help Fomento leverage the situation to its advantage by forcing MMC to terminate the agreement, and consequently enter into litigation and claim substantial costs. “Nevertheless, it’s imperative that the government intervene in the matter and salvage the situation in the interests of the city and its people. Waste management technology keeps on innovating every four-five years and thus, the technology employed at Sonsoddo plant appears to have been outdated. An innovative technological solution is what is needed at Sonsoddo,” the source said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Goa CM to discuss state\u2019s prioritie.description: PANAJI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant will meet Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday and discuss state’s priorities in the Union Budget. He is likely to seek a special financial package for the state owing to the dwindling resources in view of the mining closure. “The meeting is exclusively with the finance minister as it is the requirement before the budget. If possible, I will call on one or two ministers,” Sawant said on Thursday. “I have no plans to meet the mines minister for now, but in July,” he said, adding, “I will disclose on Friday whether the state will opt for a special package.” The chief minister had recently said that mining activities in Goa may resume in November this year. \nL\u2019Or\u00e9al Professionnel unveil.description: After four years, L’Oréal Professionnel upped the ante of The Colour Trophy by unveiling it in a new avatar as the Indian Hairdressing Awards, making it a platform to showcase the creativity of talents in the industry. A category called Business Awards was also introduced, which recognises salons that demonstrate excellence in the business of hairdressing. Post four regional rounds, the finale took place in Goa in the form of a two-day salon congress with master­classes and competitions. The event kick-started with a session on cutting-edge styles and techniques by world-renowned Parisian hair artiste and L’Oréal Professionnel ambassador Laetitia Guenaou. Participating salons were also treated to a second workshop by London-based Julie Eldrett, a customer care consultant with over 35 years experience in the hair and beauty industry.  The finale, hosted by Shibani Dandekar, saw 39 hairdressers showcase the looks they created to an audience of over 500 people. The brand’s India Dream Team that comprises six hairstylists known for their exceptional artistic skill enthralled guests with a live hair artistic show themed ‘Tribes’. The guests also witnessed a show titled ‘It Looks’ by Laetitia Guenaou, who showcased hair designs from street and ready to wear looks, to more arty and prestige universes. The judges gave away nine creative awards and 12 business awards. The panel included many renowned names from the fashion and beauty industry, along with hair colour legend Jo Hansford and Michel Claire (Director, Professional Development, Professional Products Division, L’Oréal). Said Aseem Kaushik, “We are proud that we have created hairdressing history with this event, leading to a showcase of art and talent at the finale.” While Kandasamy Amali Perera from Looks Salon picked the Colour Trophy Award, for the Cut and Style Award, Noah Michael Paul from Looks Salon was the winner. For the Men’s Image Award, Rohith Kumar from B Blunt was declared the winner and for the Young Colorist Award, Sumitra Subba from Lime Lite Salon & Spa won the trophy. Various salons from across the country were also given the business awards. Visit www.indianhairdressingawards.com for more. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Solution to Sonsoddo soon: Milind.description: PANAJI: Urban development minister Milind Naik, on Wednesday, said the government is monitoring the situation at Sonsoddo and it will come out with a solution soon. Recently, chief minister Pramod Sawant had a meeting with representatives of Fomento Green, the company managing the Sonsoddo dump. The meeting was also attended by deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai, who is also the local MLA. “On basis of that meeting some solution is being worked out. So, there will be some solution,” Naik said. He said, solid waste management is a “serious issue” and the government is seized of it, to a query if any measures are taken to see that there is no repeat of Sonsoddo in other parts of the state. Sawant has declared plans of setting up of new waste treatment plants within a time frame. “It has to be done, else people will suffer. The MLAs should also take the issue seriously,” the urban development minister said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. \nUrvee Adhikaari launches debut collect.description: Designer Urvee Adhikaari launched her debut collection ‘The Bride & Her Tribe’ at the India Beach Fashion Week.  She says, “The collection is a one-stop-shop for every destination bride and her gal pals. The easiness, elegance and simplicity reflect in all the garments.”  The silhouettes are simple and flowy with minimalistic playful embroidery and detailing. Urvee’s recent trip to Russia inspired her to incorporate the crown that runs through the collection with earthy hues. The impact of the fun bachelorettes is manifested in her collection redefining the modern destination bride and her entourage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bainguinim garbage plant must be priorit.description: PANAJI: Given the ongoing garbage crisis in Margao, the state government must speed up the process to set up the solid waste management plant at Bainguinim to prevent the state capital from suffering a similar fate, Panaji MLA Atanasio Monserrate said on Wednesday. Monserrate told TOI that he was open to the idea of the Bainguinim plant being built by either Imagine Panaji Smart City Mission Development Ltd or Goa Waste Management Corporation. “Whoever can do it faster should take it up, but I want that the garbage treatment plant should come up quickly,” Monserrate said as he pointed to the unsegregated waste at the Sonsoddo garbage dump. For decades, Margao municipal council (MMC) has been dumping all kinds of waste at Sonsoddo. The untreated garbage caught fire in May and burned for days, emitting highly toxic gases. With the solid waste treatment facility at Saligao refusing to accept garbage from Panaji and Taleigao for nearly five months due to overloading of its multi-waste sorting plant, the Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP) is on the lookout for its own facility. The Saligao plant now sorts and treats garbage only from Bardez and is being expanded to treat increasing quantities. The proposed expansion was symptomatic of faulty planning, Monserrate said. “Why build a capacity of just 100 tonne and then go for expansion? When we plan for Bainguinim we should plan for the requirement of more talukas,” he said. The environment impact assessment (EIA) through National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) has been completed for the Bainguinim site and a public hearing is likely to be conducted in the coming months, sources said. CCP had procured the land at Bainguinim for the plant, but the Manohar Parrikar-led government decided to hand over the project in 2017 to Goa Waste Management Corporation where the then chief minister was chairman. According to sources, the state government is looking at three agencies to execute the Bainguinim solid waste treatment facility — Goa Waste Management Corporation, Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation and Imagine Panaji. “If required, (BJP Calangute MLA) Michael Lobo should be made chairman of Goa Waste Management Corporation or he should be given more powers to get it done. The others seem preoccupied,” Monserrate said. It’s been over a decade that the Bainguinim site was proposed to take care of waste generated in Tiswadi, Ponda and Sattari. Though the CCP has a relatively strong system of waste collection and management, it requires a facility to tackle plastic, e-waste, construction debris and other forms of complex waste. “I will take this issue up in the assembly,” Monserrate said. Congress demands appointment of Iva Fern.description: PANAJI: The Congress party on Thursday reiterated its demand for Food and Drugs Administration officer Iva Fernandes to be appointed as the designated officer to test all the fish that is sold at the Margao Wholesale fish market. In a letter to chief minister Pramod Sawant, the Congress party said that the appointment of Fernandes would instil confidence in the Goans. “People have reason to believe that Ms Iva Fernandes is being kept away to protect the fish mafia involved in importing and selling formalin-laced fish,” said state Congress president Girish Chodankar in the letter. Fernandes was the officer who inspected fish samples at the Margao wholesale fish market and detected formalin in the fish. Following the scandal, union and state ministers made various promises, including world class fish-testing laboratories at Margao. Former union minister Suresh Prabhu said the Export Inspection Agency (EIA) was to be operationalised by March 2019 but till date it has not started functioning. The Congress sought Fernandes’ appointment as the officer in charge of testing the fish and the demand was accepted the state government but even that has not been implemented. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Mining solution by July-end, will restar.description: PANAJI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant said Goa’s mining industry, which has been dormant, could be restarted by November this year with a solution for the mining imbroglio expected by as early as the end of July. The chief minister assured the mining dependants, who met him under the banner of Goa Mining People’s Front, at his office on Wednesday, to find a solution to the crisis. “Legal opinion is being taken and a solution will come out by July-end,” Sawant said. “A positive solution will come out, I am confident that by November, we will restart mining.” Sawant said that a high-level meeting chaired by PM Narendra Modi will be held in New Delhi in July, and the issue will be deliberated. While Sawant did not provide any further details on how mining operations would resume in Goa, he did say that if no legal solution was found to help restart the mines, he said, “If a solution is not found, then by (the) auction (route) we can start fresh mining. Companies should retain workers at least till then.” GMPF president Puti Gaonkar was part of the delegation that met Sawant. Though Gaonkar said that Sawant seemed confident of finding a solution, the association did not share that hope. “The CM categorically told us that a decision would be taken by July-end, whether auction or corporation or any other way. He said that he would resolve the issue and said that the issue has already been taken up by Niti Aayog,” Gaonkar said. Sawant recently met Niti Aayog officials and Union minister for mines Pralhad Joshi to discuss Goa’s mining issue. “I am not confident at all,” Gaonkar said. “We are listening to all these assurances for the past one year, even from the prime minister.” Reacting to Sawant’s assurance, Goa Barge Owners Association president William D’Costa questioned the rationale. He pointed out that barges, which are required to transport the extracted mines, are defunct or functioning on a skeleton crew. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSounia Gohil launches her resortwear l.description: Inspired by destination weddings, designer Sounia Gohil launched her resortwear line ‘A Whimsical Tale’ at the India Beach Fashion Week in Goa recently.  Minimal embellishments and sheer fabrics made this a fun, fusion collection. The line also featured an amalgamation of digital and subtle architectural prints in morning to evening shades, with easy silhouettes lending a relaxed appeal. The line had an assortment of feminine resort wear, lehengas, gowns, jackets and crop-tops. The well-layered pieces were crafted using lycra and satin drapes while cutwork appliqué was sprinkled to add sparkle to the collection. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018White paper on power dept to be on.description: MARGAO: Power minister Nilesh Cabral on Thursday said that a white paper dealing with the status, functioning and projects of the state’s electricity department would be uploaded on the department’s website shortly.  Cabral said he would also soon come out with a policy of performance-based incentives for the employees of the department. Stating that the power infrastructure would be upgraded, the minister said the government, which has already started purchasing power from the Western grid, would revert purchasing from the Southern grid only after a new power substation at Dharbondara for South Goa is made operational. Responding to criticism by “some opposiition MLAs” about poor power infrastructure in their constituencies, Cabral said he has never discriminated between ruling and opposition legislators. Reacting to Navelim MLA Luizinho Faleiro’s accusations that new power connections have been released to two big construction projects in Navelim, Cabral said those were released under Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) norms. He also said that a Rs 61-crore tender has also been floated for setting up a new 400 KVA transformer at Navelim. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

People must cooperate if garbage issue i.description: PANAJI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday visited the Goa solid waste management plant at Saligao and took stock of plans for garbage management in the state. Despite a busy schedule in view of Goa Revolution Day celebrations, Sawant made his maiden visit to the Saligao plant and expressed happiness over its functioning. “We have finalised few places like Kundaim, Pissurlem and Colvale to set up treatment plants for e-waste, bio-medical and hazardous waste,” he said during his meeting with officials and members of the Solid Waste Management Corporation. These three sites will be in the industrial estate, run by Goa Industrial Development Corporation, sources said. He said that “a total of 150 tonnes of garbage from all over the state is treated here per day in a well-processed manner”. Sawant recalled that the foundation stone of this treatment plant was laid during his tenure as the vice-chairman of Goa State Infrastructure Development Corporation (GSIDC). Mapusa MLA Joshua D’Souza, Solid Waste Management Corporation’s managing director Levinson Martins and others were present on the occasion. Sawant was also told that the plant is run on power generated from the waste. Sources said that over the past few months, collection and transportation of garbage to the plant from some panchayats has stopped. According to an official press release, the chief minister also spoke about steps taken to make Goa open-defecation free (ODF) by July 31. Currently as per the national survey conducted by the central government, Goa is at the bottom for performance on ODF parameters. Stating that the government has also introduced the concept of bio-toilet, he said 17,000 bio-toilets are demanded by various panchayats all over Goa. Pulmonary tests for Sonsoddo firefighter.description: PANAJI: Firemen who were deployed at the Sonsoddo garbage dump between May 27 an d June 4 to douse the fire, underwent lung and pulmonary tests on Wednesday. For eight days, 345 firefighters were deployed on rotation, round-the-clock, at Sonsoddo waste dump, said Ashok Menon, director of fire and emergency services. The check-up for fire fighters was conducted by Manipal Hospital as part of its corporate social responsibility. The reports will be ready in two to three days. Menon said that though he did not receive any complaints from his men of ill-health after their Sonsoddo duty, he thought it was better to get tested as they were exposed to excessive fumes and toxic smells. “Human resource shouldn’t be disregarded. Though firefighters wear masks, it can’t be complete protection,” he said. He added that one can’t wear a mask without a break, and while working firefighters will remove his mask either to wipe off sweat or breathe. Fire services conducts annual medical health check-ups for firefighters but this is the first time they have undergone lung and pulmonary tests. All were invited but a few didn’t turn up. Goa: Rs 1cr subsidy for dairy community.description: PANAJI: With the objective to encourage large dairy units in the state and boost milk production, the Goa government has come out with a scheme to provide subsidy of up to Rs 1 crore for community dairy farming. In a notification issued on Thursday, the animal husbandry department said the subsidy is limited to a maximum of Rs 1 crore at the rate of 50% of permissible unit cost. The department said that the concept of community dairy farming had been under the consideration of the government for a long time to facilitate group of people coming together with a common intention of taking up dairy farming on community basis. The government had observed that the small units of around ten cow dairy farms are not much profitable to take up as a business entrepreneur. The scheme was proposed to encourage such dairy farming with minimum of 50 milch animals and with latest ultra modern equipment which can be availed by a community group of minimum of five members. The beneficiary community group will have to run the unit for at least ten years after signing an agreement with the directorate of animal husbandry and veterinary services. The subsidy will be released only after completion of the unit in all respects and only after it is certified by the department committee set up for the purpose. Any group having at least five members should possess irrigated land for green fodder cultivation at the rate of minimum of 5 acres for 50 animals. Each member would have to be a resident of Goa for atleast five years and having some experience in dairy management. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Goa govt moves to correct 'flawed TCP no.description: PANAJI: The state government has finally moved to correct a flawed Town and Country Planning (TCP) notification by releasing a draft notification on Thursday which permits the reduction in open spaces in existing industrial estates too. The earlier Goa Regulation of Land Development and Building Construction Regulations, which were notified by the TCP department in September 2018, permitted the reduction in open spaces from 15% to 7.5% in only new industrial estates. “The government plans to amend the regulations and has pre-published the draft rules for objections and suggestions which have to be submitted in 30 days,” said chief town planner (administration) James Mathew. Grappling with a shortage of industrial land, the Goa Industrial Development Corporation wants to utilise open spaces in industrial areas for development of industrial plots. According to senior officials, when GIDC wrote to the TCP department to amend the Goa Regulation of Land Development and Building Construction Regulations it failed to specify that the reduction in open spaces should be applicable to existing industrial estates. The fresh norms released by TCP now seek to amend rule 12.4 by specifying that GIDC “may realign, revise, reduce the open spaces maintained by it in any existing industrial estate” in the state. The draft rules also state that aside from the requirement of 7.5% of the total area being kept aside as open space, the remaining area in industrial estates shall be “deemed to be zoned as industrial area.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Dredging of Ragado river: WRD to act.description: KERI: The water resources department has decided to take legal action against the persons involved in dredging the river bed of the Ragado in Tambdi Surla in Sacordem. Following a report by TOI on June 19 on the haphazard dredging of the river, the department officials have taken serious note of the violators involved in the activity. Gopinath Desai, WRD executive engineer, said, “As per the directives of the chief engineer, we have decided to take action against those involved in dredging the river. As per the allotment of the tender, the work of improvement of the Ragado waterways was completed. Our department is in no way connected with the dredging that was going on in the Ragado.” Work towards the improvement of waterways commenced on June 3 and was scheduled to be completed by June 12 this year. Though this work was completed as per the tender, some persons used an excavator to remove pebbles, sand and boulders from the river bed and transported it all to stone-crushing units. From there, the material was allegedly sold. As dredging was being conducted haphazardly, the villagers brought the violation to the notice of the deputy collector of Dharbandora, Nilesh Dhaigodkar on June 18. Collem police subsequently discovered that the dredging had been stopped. On Wednesday, when WRD officials visited the site, they found dredging in progress. A complaint was lodged and Collem police stopped the work. WRD canal officer Ankush Gaonkar was directed to take action against those involved in dredging. Citizens\u2019 groups unite to oppose ca.description: PANAJI: Activists representing various social groups, NGOs and political parties protested against casinos at Azad Maidan in Panaji on Tuesday. The protest was organized by Aam Aurat Aadmi Against Gambling. Last week, the organisation lodged a police complaint regarding a website advising tourists how to get women for various activities, including gambling. AAAAG convener Sabina Martins, said the state has suffered immensely due to casino gambling where prosperous families have become paupers, and assets and properties of people have been usurped under the pretext of clearing debts. The rules and gaming commissioner haven’t been put in place yet and there is no check on the money charged either, she said. Martins went on to list many social drawbacks of casinos, saying hotels are getting a bad reputation as casino visitors with escorts seek lodging while public property like jetties, pavements, footpaths are appropriated. Subsequent governments have gone against the objective of the Goa Gambling Prevention Act and have brought about several amendments to promote casino gambling instead of curtailing the ill effects, she said. 20% state govt employees do not work: Pr.description: PANAJI: In a harsh critique of the state’s government employees, chief minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday said 20% of them did not work and that “necessary action would be taken against them to get them to work”. Sawant, who was speaking to reporters at the BJP headquarters after a meeting with karyakartas, said that it was the complaint of party workers that government employees were not doing their work. “If you consider that 80% of the government employees work, then the remaining 20% do not work,” he said. Most people in the state want government jobs, he added. Further, responding to a question about whether government employees were involved in cheating people, the chief minister said that “there are a few”. “I have received three complaints stating that government employees are involved in asking for money in exchange for jobs and that some are doing so in the name of ministers, including mine,” Sawant said, adding that action will be taken against these people as soon as possible. “Such type of activities should stop in Goa,” he said. “I am categorically specifying that nobody should give money to secure government jobs. In this government there is no need to give money for jobs,” Sawant said. If anyone asks for money for government jobs then a police complaint should be filed against the person, the chief minister said, adding that citizens could also complain to the chief minister’s office regarding any issues with government servants, especially corruption. Sawant said most public grievances would be resolved if the administration was streamlined. “I am trying to do this. I have told the bureaucracy that if I receive any complaint against them, including that of corruption, then action will be taken,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two Goan firms amongst five to supply 16.description: PANAJI: The move to install bio-toilets for citizens who don’t have household latrines has taken a significant step forward with Goa Waste Management Corporation (GWMC) issuing work orders to four of the five selected firms to supply bio-digestor toilets, which included two local firms, among five companies who bid for the contract. Om Ventures and Cam Industrial services are the two Goan firms, along with Kaya Frontier JV pvt ltd, LNA Infra Projects and Banka Bio Loo ltd who will supply bio-toilets to the government at Rs 58,184 per unit, inclusive of taxes, while beneficiaries will receive these units at subsidized rates. Managing director, GWMC, Levinson Martins, told TOI on Thursday, that the fifth company would be issued the work order today after it completes contractual formalities. “Orders are being issued for supply of individual household toilets which will be provided to 17,150 beneficiaries who submitted applications with the village panchayats,” said Martins. Each company will provide biodigester toilets along with the anaerobic multi-compartment tank, and the entire 700lt capacity bio-digester toilet will be built with composite materials for easy installation, officials said. A bio-digester toilet is a multi-compartment tank which digests fecal matter biologically. “Of the applications received by the government, 980 applicants have no land and cannot be considered as beneficiaries under the scheme. Effectively we are going ahead with 16,170 toilets,” the official said. During their state-wide survey, the two entities involved – the directorate of Municipal Administration (DMA) and with the Rural Development Agency (RDA) - estimated a requirement of 60,000, but only 17,150 applications were received by village panchayats from applicants. “Initially the survey was done by RDA and they identified 53,000 odd beneficiaries while the DMA said there is a need for 4,500 biotoilets which adds up to between 57,000 to 58,000 units. Then chief minister, Manohar Parrikar, said that a few more applications may come in, so we kept a round figure of 60,000 bio-toilets. Now the directorate of panchayats will accept fresh applications if they come in,” a government official said. To ensure Goa achieves an open defecation free (ODF) status, the then chief minister, Manohar Parrikar, had said that Goa government would install 60,000 bio-toilets costing Rs 280 crore. Prime Minister, Narendra Modi had launched the ODF programme on October 2, 2014 under the Swachh Bharat Mission–Gramin. A deadline of October 2, 2019 was fixed for all states to eradicate open defecation. In May 2019, chief minister, Pramod Sawant, had said that it would take six months to supply and setup the bio-digester toilets for the intended beneficiaries across the state. For second day, uncollected trash raises.description: MARGAO: For the second day in a row, residents of Margao woke up to their town pervaded with an all-consuming stink, as the Margao Municipal Council (MMC) continued to struggle to collect garbage. In many parts of the commercial capital, garbage lay around in overflowing bins and around them, until the MMC began clearing the piles late on Wednesday evening. Waste that is usually collected every morning was only lifted later in the day.  The problem started on Monday, when Fomento, the concessionaire of the solid waste management (SWM) plant, refused to accept incoming waste from MMC trucks for want of space inside the plant to accommodate it. Meanwhile, at Sonsoddo, the MMC has started clearing the waste from inside the shed on a war footing deploying large number of trucks and labourers for the exercise. A number of heavy earthmoving machines were also seen deployed at the site. Sources in the MMC said that while a portion of the shed has been cleared of the rejects accumulated therein, it will take some more days for completely moving rejects out of the shed. “Out of more than 1,000 tonnes of reject accumulated inside the shed, over 20% of it has been cleared,” a source in the MMC said. The reject taken out of the shed are now being dumped onto the existing garbage dump outside the plant. Incidentally, a fire broke out once again at the garbage dump Wednesday evening hampering the garbage-clearing exercise. “Smoke had started billowing from the dump. One fire tender was used to extinguish it,” a fire officer said. Fomento maintained that the entire volume of rejects needs to be moved out before any more waste can be treated at the plant. Meanwhile, in areas like Aquem and Borda where door-to-door collection wasn’t done for three days, residents were left with no option but to dump their waste at convenient spots on nearby streets. People were seen taking their bins and garbage bags on their two-wheelers and dumping them at various spots around the town. By the time MMC began collecting waste on Wednesday, its resources fell woefully short. While some of the trucks were offloaded on the garbage dump outside the plant, several garbage-laden trucks were seen parked elsewhere waiting to be offloaded. “They didn’t collect our waste for three days,” said a senior citizen from Aquem. “It began to stink so I asked my neighbour to throw it at the corner of our street.” The MMC gave each household two bins for wet and dry waste in 2015, but most began segregating only four days ago, when municipal workers asked them to do so. Some who began segregating stopped after the workers themselves mixed the waste while collecting it. Former MMC chairperson Savio Coutinho said that councillors have an important role to play. “They should personally visit households and ask people to segregate garbage,” he said. “Citizens are more likely to listen to their local councillor than the municipal worker who is often not a local and who may not speak the local language fluently.” Even those residents of the town who went shopping weren’t spared the stink. “The stench was unbearable,” said Julia F from Malbhat, a market-goer. President of the New Market Traders Association, Vinod Shirodkar, alleged that the municipality was regular in collecting waste from hotels and restaurants, but meted out second-class treatment to the market and households. “The government continues to grant permissions to buildings in the vicinity of Sonsoddo,” he said. “Construction activity is still on.” MMC’s exercise of scouting for places in Curtorim and Margao to segregate waste before transporting to the Sonsoddo plant continued on Wednesday. It has however, identified a place in Fatorda, sources said. Sonsoddo garbage plant caters to waste generated in Margao, Fatorda and Curtorim. Fomento has now insisted on only segregated waste to be brought at its Sonsoddo plant. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pleas for disqualification of 2 MLAs to.description: PANAJI: Assembly speaker Rajesh Patnekar will begin hearing the disqualification petition filed against deputy chief minister Manohar Ajgaonkar and PWD minister Deepak Pauskar from July 1. Last month, senior MGP leader and former deputy chief minister Ramkrishna Dhavalikar, had filed a petition before the speaker seeking that Ajgaonkar and Pauskar who quit MGP to join BJP in March be disqualified. The petition challenged the duo’s claim that two-thirds of the MGP legislature party had merged with BJP. MGP had three MLAs in the 40-member House. A petition in this regard is also pending before the high court. Sadanand Vaingankar had moved the court challenging the speaker’s order approving the merger of the MGP legislature party into BJP. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Take government loans to buy car, join G.description: PANAJI: In a move to to counter the opposition to GoaMiles by the local taxi operators, the state government is planning to offer loans to unemployed youths to buy vehicles. But these loans, offered through economic development corporation come with a rider: The beneficiaries of this scheme will have to enrol their vehicles with the government’s app-based service GoaMiles. Beneficiaries will also get subsidy towards vehicle insurance and scholarships for their children, Goa Tourism Development Corporation chairman Dayanand Sopte told reporters here on Wednesday. He also asked the local cabbies to join GoaMiles for a month and experience its functioning. During the past few days, opposition to GoaMiles has grown with some altercations happening between tourist taxi operators and app-based drivers. “The Goa government has taken a firm decision to stand by the GoaMiles initiative in the interest of tourism in the state. The government will neither buckle down to any sort of pressure from vested interests nor to their demands to stop or scrap the app-based taxi service,” he said. “We would urge local taxi operators who have not joined the initiative to sign up with GoaMiles, which is completing a year of successful operations this August, instead of standing on the sidelines protesting against it,” Sopte said. The allegations by taxi operators against GoaMiles are baseless and out of sheer ignorance and jealously, as several of their former colleagues are doing extremely well after joiningit, he said. Enlisting the achievements of GoaMiles in the last year, the GTDC chairman said, “On commissioning the service in August 2018, the fleet has steadily risen from 55 vehicles to 1,400 cabs.” The app-based taxi service which started with 1,500 trips per month touched around 14,000 trips in December 2018 and in June 2019, has recorded more than 20,000 trips per month. “Similarly, on an average, a taxi driver registered with GoaMiles earns around Rs 3,500 per day without having to lose on commission, which other app-based taxi services operating nationally charge,” Sopte said. This figure is much more than what a non-GoaMiles driver earns in a day and the earning potential is directly proportional to the hard work put in by the driver. He said that GoaMiles is not an ‘outsider’. “Even other app-based taxi services may not have as much local genes as much as GoaMiles has,” Sopte said. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Vishwajit Rane allays fears, says fish i.description: PANAJI: Health minister Vishwajit Rane on Tuesday accused Benaulim NCP MLA Churchill Alemao of attempting to create panic among the people by asking them not to eat fish till August 15. “There is nothing to worry about. Fish available in the markets of Goa is safe for consumption. Food safety is the highest priority of my government. A monitoring system has been put in place. The government is very serious on the issue. It knows what is to be done,” Rane said. On Monday, Alemao had urged citizens to refrain from consuming fish during the two-month ban period. He hinted that fish entering Goa’s markets from other states during the ban could contain formalin. Insisting that Alemao’s claims be dismissed, Rane said random checks are being conducted and fish samples are even being collected for testing. “A whole protocol has been laid down. It is mandated that fish has to be transported in insulated vehicles. Fish transport vehicles that have inadequate documents are not to be allowed to enter the state,” he said. “Chief minister Pramod Sawant, deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai and I had a joint meeting to discuss this issue.” Rane said Alemao was a “good human being, but uneducated on facts”. While Goa procures fish from neighbouring states throughout the year, it relies heavily on this arrangement when the annual fishing ban is enforced from June 1. After the formalin-in-fish controversy erupted last year, fish coming in from other states was banned for a while. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPulkit Samrat meets winners of Times W.description: The seventh edition of the Times Women’s Drive culminated with a glamorous award night at Zuri White Sands, Varca Beach, Goa. An all-women drive, it’s an expression of solidarity to unite for various social causes and create awareness through friendships and achievements. The drive has emerged as a platform for modern Indian women, who’ve resolved to take up new challenges and voice their concern on issues affecting women. Times Women’s Drive is supported by Women’s Cancer Initiative Tata Memorial Hospital, conducted by IARC. Interestingly, the drive had set Guinness World Record on February 22, 2014 for most female participants in a motorsport event, with 934 contestants.  This year, the drive was made more challenging by increasing the distance and making it a two-day event. The new test drive did not deter the participants, but further strengthened their resolve. After concluding what’s touted to be the longest two-day drive in the country, participants reached Goa to attend the glittering award ceremony, which set the momentum for International Women’s Day. Chief Minister of Goa, Laxmikant Yashwant Parsekar, attended the award ceremony and welcomed all the women participants from Maharashtra and Karnataka to the sunny state of Goa. He spoke about diverse schemes implemented by the state of Goa for women’s welfare and made an appeal to all participants to enjoy the natural beauty and cultural diversity of the state by extending their stay. Actor Pulkit Samrat, who gave away awards to the winners, said, “Behind every fast car, there is sassy woman and I am privileged to be a part of this ceremony.” The participants of the Times Women’s Drive were also judged in various categories including Best Social Message, Best Dressed Team, Best Decorated Car, Most Social Active Team, Best Creative Group-fie, Best Team Name, Most Fashionable Woman and Best Make-up. Neeraj Arya’s neo folk band Kabir Café mesmerised audience with mystic poet Kabir’s verses in a contemporary style, fusing folk with R&B, rock, pop and Carnatic flavours. DJ Tarun, known for his electrifying EDM, kept the women dancing till the wee hours with his pulsating upbeat dance music. In short, it was a special evening to remember for all the participants who braved the ghats of Sahyadri to reach Goa to create awareness about various social causes, including women’s cancer. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

This year\u2019s monsoon delay in Goa se.description: PANAJI: After a delay of 14 days, the state breathed a sigh of relief as the monsoon made its way to Goa on Thursday. Prior to this, the most delayed start of the rainy season this decade was in 2016, when the monsoon hit the state on June 10. Earlier, the India meteorological department (IMD) had predicted that the likelihood of the monsoon covering the state may go beyond June 21 which in itself would’ve been a record this decade. According to statistics shared by the IMD, the monsoon usually arrives by June 6 and withdraws by October 8. But this time round, the arrival of the rains as late as June 20 was baffling. The rainy season was derailed in the aftermath of cyclonic storm Vayu which passed parallel to Goa’s coast last week. “The severe cyclone Vayu absorbed all the moisture in the atmosphere and taken it to the north, to the Gujarat coast. The moisture has therefore incurred there due to the cyclonic circulation,” IMD director, K V Padgalwar had told TOI. Isolated parts of the state have witnessed slight pre-monsoon showers over the week. These were, however, baby steps towards the season. The trough formed on Wednesday night and its formation was declared by the IMD on Thursday morning. “This is an off-shore trough from south Maharashtra coast to Kerala coast which is responsible for the heavy rainfall on the western coast on Thursday,” IMD scientist S D Sanap said. IMD Goa has approached the National Data Centre (NDC) in Pune for more information to compare statistics of the past three decades. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC notices to NGPDA, 12 others over Baga.description: PANAJI: The high court of Bombay at Goa has issued notices to the North Goa Planning and Development Authority and 12 others in connection with a PIL seeking the declaration of Baga hill as a no-development zone. Notices are returnable on July 1. Filed by Agnel Barreto, Peter D’Souza and the Goa Foundation, the PIL had sought the intervention of the court for the conservation of the forested Baga hill that is located in the village of Arpora-Nagoa, at the northern border of the village of Calangute and is also partly shared by the village of Anjuna. It is their contention that a road has been proposed through the forested hill to benefit real estate interests and resort developers. “It was for this purpose that the existing forest vegetation had been burnt and destroyed in order to begin construction of the road, plots and buildings – a prospect, which if allowed, will mean the end of the Baga hill for all times to come,” the petitioners stated. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pilgao goes without power for 5 hours.description: BICHOLIM: Villagers from Pilgao, especially school students of Ideal High School located in the village, had a hard time on Tuesday as there was no power supply for almost five hours in the area. The village in Bicholim has been facing power outages over the last three to four days. While officials of the electricity department said power supply tends to get disrupted due to gusty winds, villagers claimed that they have had to go without power for at least two hours on a daily basis. On Tuesday, the outage lasted for five hours. The villagers and school authorities have called on the power minister to work towards underground cabling to avoid further inconveniences. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

One held for theft of batteries, generat.description: POINGUINIM: Canacona police arrested Gautam Khavnekar of Talpona for stealing six batteries of a crane stationed at Talpona and a generator from Galgibaga, all worth Rs 50,000. He was charged under Section 41 of the criminal procedure code. A police complaint by Vinay Kumar of M Venkat Rao Infra Projects Pvt Ltd stated that the accused stole the batteries and the generator on June 17. The police carried out a search for him and on finding him, brought him to the police station and arrested him. The batteries and generator have been recovered. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mormugao Port Trust expects 1.5 lakh cru.description: PANAJI: Around 70,000 to 80,000 cruise passengers arrived at Mormugao Port Trust in the 2018-19 tourist season, but next season could see 1.5 lakh cruise passengers disembarking at the port to take in Goa’s sights, said MPT chairman E Ramesh Kumar. Speaking at a workshop on cruise tourism, Kumar also said that the number of cruise vessel arrivals would double in the coming year. Tempering the optimism, western region director for India Tourism Neela Lad said that MPT, port authorities, Customs & Central Excise, Bureau of Immigration and security agencies have to work in tandem if cruise tourism had to really take off in Goa. “There is a tremendous increase in the cruise tourism. Cruise passenger arrivals were around 70,000 to 80,000 during the just concluded season and I am confident the figures will touch to around 1.5 lakhs in the current year,” said Kumar in his official address. The workshop was organised to improve the inter-agency coordination and simplification of procedures in order to provide a “hassle free experience” to cruise passengers, said MPT officials.
